meanings.definition: A person who is skilled in the use of colors, especially in painting.
meanings.sent1: The art gallery featured many talented titians who painted beautiful landscapes.
meanings.sent2: The famous titians of the Renaissance era created masterpieces that still inspire artists today.
meanings.sent3: The titians at the art school had a paintbrush duel to determine the best artist.
meanings.sent4: Her skills with colors made her a true titian among her peers.
meanings.sent5: The titians' vibrant paintings brought life to the dull walls of the museum.

meanings.sent1: The autumn leaves turned a lovely titians hue as the season changed.
meanings.sent2: She chose a titians dress for the party to match the warm tones of the decorations.
meanings.sent3: The titians shade of lipstick made her smile even brighter.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in a titians glow, signaling the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The old barn was painted in a titians color, blending beautifully with the rural landscape.
